greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..8} floor(A254876(n,k)/A254876(n-1,k)), where A254876(n,k) = n! / (Product_{m=(n-floor((2n)/(3^k))) .. (n-floor((n)/(3^k)))} m).
comment: A self-similar Cantor-type sequence with eight levels. [The original name of the sequence.]
This sequence resembles a Conway $10000-type chaotic sequence in its plot.
The above claim is dubious. The plots of this and A004001 do not resemble each other, at least for the first 10000 terms when using the plot-script of OEIS server.
The first three eights occur in positions 2, 3281, 9842.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
mathematica: p[n_, k_]=n!/Product[i, {i, n-Floor[2*n/3^k], n-Floor[n/3^k]}] digits=200 f[n_]=Sum[Floor[p[n, k]/p[n-1, k]], {k, 1, 8}] at=Table[f[n], {n, 2, digits}] (* fractal plot*) ListPlot[at, PlotJoined->True, PlotRange->All]
program: ;; The following function implements sum_{i=lowlim..uplim} intfun(i)
(define (add intfun lowlim uplim) (let sumloop ((i lowlim) (res 0)) (cond ((> i uplim) res) (else (sumloop (1+ i) (+ res (intfun i)))))))
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Nov 09 2003
